Problem:
Consider a function \\( g(z) = e^{i\\theta}z \\) applied to a complex function \\( z(t) \\) which evolves by the system \\( \\dot{z} = kz \\), with k being a complex constant. This problem examines how transformations and system dynamics interact over time.

If \\( g(z) \\) is applied to a complex number \\( z_0 \\) at t = 0, and then allowed to evolve under \\( \\dot{z} = kz \\) without further intervention, will \\( z(t) \\) at t = T remain purely dependent on the evolution under \\( \\dot{z} = kz \\), unaffected by \\( g(z) \\)?
Explanation: Applying \\( g(z) \\) modifies the initial state to \\( e^{i\\theta}z_0 \\). The evolution under \\( \\dot{z} = kz \\) from this modified initial condition results in \\( z(T) = e^{kT}e^{i\\theta}z_0 \\), which differs by a complex phase factor e^{i\\theta} from the direct evolution \\( e^{kT}z_0 \\). Thus, \\( z(T) \\) depends significantly on the initial transformation by \\( g(z) \\).
